children.subject: We would offer it in session C (8 weeks) and we currently have lecture time as 11-12:30 and labs in the afternoon (probably 2-5pm and 5-8pm sections to choose from although this is not finalized yet)

Nooo 184 is during that time slot :((((((((((((((((( 

Is there a possibility this could be webcasted as 184 is not? Thanks.

We are planning to try to get a webcast but we unfortunately can’t guarantee it right now :(((
Please fill out the interest form though in case we can get a webcast! :)
Is there any idea of time slot this would be offered in? And I presume session C?
We’ll be releasing a separate form later for hiring :)
Is there any way for interested parties to help out as remote course staff (readers, notes, piazza, etc.)?

EE 120 is listed on Berkeley’s course site as a prereq because I think many years ago it used to be necessary for this class and for whatever reason they wont remove it but now it’s not needed. All you need is linear algebra and Python.
I see on Berkeley’s course guide that EE120 as a prerequisite. Will EE120’s material not be needed for this offering of 106?
4 units
If offered how many units will this class be ? 4
Undergrads I think
It will be a small team of grad/undergrad students along with a few guest lectures from a professor or two
Will it be taught by a professor or a team of graduate students?

Labs are expected to be completed within the allotted lab section times so homework is the only outside of class commitment and is expected to take about 5-10 hrs each. During final project time, however, there will be no labs or homework so all your class time outside of lecture will be expected to go into working on your project.
Do you expect us to spend a lot of time outside the class to complete labs and project? In other words, what's your expected time commitment for this summer offering.
We had to remove it for a bit because of logistical/administrative things in terms of it being cross listed as both an EECS and BioE course :(
The link above appears to be broken. Is it still on classes.berkeley.edu?
Students could maybe SSH into the robots and monitor them with webcams XD

Lol while that would be great it is unfortunately a huge safety hazard. If summer classes are forced to be online only we won’t be able to offer 106a since there’s really no way for you all to do the labs without the robots :(
Move everything online like 106B? Sounds like an extremely painful amount of work though.
Honestly I feel like this class is about the lab. Why take it if it's gonna be all online :(
For the T H E O R Y.
If worst case summer classes also need to be held online, will this class be canceled considering its lab intensive?
No just linear algebra and Python
Does it require EE 16B?
Ya unfortunately we don't have the means to make everything online for this class in time for the summer session :(
Hi, will u guys consider offering it again during summer next year?

Considering the growing popularity of the class and how many people were interested in it this summer I think there’s a pretty good chance we will but it all really depends on next year’s course staff
Very cool, "a pretty good chance" is certainly enough. Thanks
Summer classes will now be online. I'm guessing this will no longer be happening?

history.content:
Edit: Since all summer classes will be online only, we unfortunately will be unable to offer EECS C106A this summer as it is a lab heavy class and we don't have the time or manpower to completely rework the course to work entirely online. Thank you all for your interest and hopefully we will see you in the fall! 

Hey everyone!

We are considering a Summer 2020 offering of EECS/BioE C106A/206A. This class is an introduction to robotics. It covers the fundamentals of kinematics, dynamics, and control of robot manipulators, robotic vision, and sensing.

The course will consist of four 1.5 hour lectures along with two 3 hour labs a week. The lectures are supplemented with homeworks and experimental work in the laboratory using several Baxter, Sawyer, and TurtleBot robots. There will be one midterm and no final exam. The last three weeks of the class will be dedicated to a final project that students will complete in teams of 3-5. Lectures those last three weeks will consist of special topics, applications, and perhaps some guest lectures.

For prerequisites, this class only requires familiarity with linear algebra and some programming experience in Python.

Right now we would like to gauge interest in offering this course for the summer so please fill out this form if you are interested.

#pin
history.subject: Potential Offering of Summer EECS/BioE C106A/206A

history.content:
EDIT: The course is now listed on classes.berkeley.edu and can be found here! However, enrollment is still not yet open so please still be sure to fill out the interest form on this post and we will email everyone who filled it out when enrollment officially opens. 

Please note that there is a dummy discussion section listed on Fridays to comply with school policy. This will most likely be treated as office hours/open lab section and not as an actual discussion section so you do not need to be available for that time. We will also open up a MW 2-5pm lab section if we get enough interest.
